Times July 25] of the maximum trajectory of Reggie Jackson's All-Star Game home run to be quite accurate in terms of a mathematical exercise. However, when it comes to the physical realities of the event, I'm afraid that the professor's analysis would have been better suited to the golf drives of Astronaut Alan Shepard on the moon.

results.lead_paragraph: The enormous progress made by the United States manned space program in just two years has been amply demonstrated by Falcon's stay on the lunar surface. Astronauts Scott and Irwin have already accomplished many times as much useful work as did their pioneering predecessors during all of Apollo ll's stayin July, 1969.

results.abstract: Apollo 15 astronauts gather rock from Hadley Rille apparently thrown down during 1 of volcanic eruptions that produced uppermost layers of lunar seas (W Sullivan rept); dating of these rocks should pinpoint period when formation of seas on moon's earth-facing side ended; astronauts also collect rocks from foot of Apennine Mts which appear to be fragments of early lunar crust; observations of sloping lines in face of Mt Hadley has raised possibility that original crust was laid down in layers; Dr Allen says evidence of possible layering is 1 of major surprises of Apollo 15 mission; layering is unexpected because Apennines material is thought to predate volcanic activity responsible for lava beds of lunar seas; Dr Farouk el-Baz, geologist who trained astronauts for mission, says their observation of layering seems to eliminate theory that Hadley Rille was produced by collapse of tunnel formed by flowing lava; says astronaut Maj Worden's observation of cones on SE rim of Sea of Serenity appears to confirm that some, if not all, of cones are of volcanic origin; cones are similar to cinder cones found in some volcanic areas on earth; map
